intro: Sida rostrata, commonly known as the beakweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense spikes, and its leaves are typically oval with a slightly hairy surface. Sida rostrata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
